footer.text: Character Guide • Build: Yanfei | Update Date: 02/06/2024 | Editor: ._.samantha._.

fields.name: Best Weapon(s):
fields.value:
__Lost Prayers to the Sacred Winds__
5 Star Best-in-Slot option owing to the nature of Yanfei’s playstyle where she is On-Field for extended periods of time, taking advantage of the weapon passive splendidly.

__Widsith__
Yanfei’s 4 star Best-in-Slot, being able to capitalize on all 3 note buffs for the duration of her damage window. At high refinements, the note buffs are potent enough to be capable of succeeding 5 star weapon options.

__Flowing Purity__
The Fontaine craftable option that works in Vaporize and Mono-Pyro.

fields.name: Replacement Weapon(s):
fields.value:
__Kagura’s Verity__
When using 2 skills per rotation, Yanfei is able to attain and maintain the maximum stacks by the start of the second rotation; enabling Yanfei to make use of its max stack condition for a decent boost to her DMG Bonus.

__Solar Pearl__
Plainly a CRIT statstick as the passive does not buff Yanfei’s main source of personal damage, being her charged attacks.

__Dodoco Tales__
Should players have this event-exclusive weapon, it still remains as a strong F2P option on Yanfei in this playstyle.

__Mappa Mare__
Decently strong F2P option provided players can spare the billet(s) needed.

fields.name: Main Stats Priority
fields.value: <sands> ATK%|<goblet>Pyro DMG Bonus%|<circlet>CRIT DMG or CRIT Rate

fields.name: Talent Priority
fields.value:
**1)** Normal Attack: Seal of Approval
**2)** Elemental Burst: Done Deal
**3)** Elemental Skill: Signed Edict

fields.name: Notes:
fields.value: __Marechaussee Hunter__ would work only in Burgeon or with Furina. It is recommended to play with Furina for Vaporize teams and uptime on the CRIT Rate buff.

footer.text: Character Guide • Build: Yanfei | Update Date: 08/26/2022 | Editor: Luno#1337

fields.name: Best Weapon(s):
fields.value:
__Sacrificial Fragments__
Strongest option for Yanfei’s personal damage owing to a high EM substat. Spacing out of skill uses when the weapon passive procs is advised in order for electro auras to be maintained.

__Thrilling Tales of Dragon Slayers__
Provides a potent buff to a single party member, but mandates a structured rotation in order to properly pass the TTDS buff to the character who benefits most from it.
** **

fields.name: Replacement Weapon(s):
fields.value:
__Magic Guide__
Inexpensive variant of sacrificial fragments but with slightly less damage potential.

__Hakushin Ring__
Hakushin Ring’s weapon passive is extremely easy both to proc and maintain as Yanfei claims ownership over most, if not all overloads. Great multi-buffing qualities coupled with more flexible rotations makes this weapon comparable to the buff of Thrilling Tales of Dragon Slayers. 

** **

fields.name: Talent Priority
fields.value: Talents need not be levelled in this playstyle

fields.name: Notes:
fields.value:
CRIT Rate substats are to be voided in this playstyle due to her A4 applying more instances of pyro application which, although good in-theory, is not actually beneficial. This is in light of the extra pyro application instance messing up the auras on the enemy; resulting in less overloads owned by Yanfei.

Should players have neither of the 4-piece artifact sets that boost her overload damage, running +80 EM 2-piece sets is an option.
When opting for instructors as one of said +80 EM sets, it is recommended to only run the set piece on the flower and feather.
